name: Simplified Issue Whole Life (SIWL)
features: Level death benefit, guaranteed level premium, whole life maturing at age 121
Face amounts $5,000–$40,000 (Standard), $25,000–$40,000 (Preferred)
No paramedical exam required—reflexive medical questions only
Preferred build-chart eligibility uses height/weight table (page 19)
Accelerated Death Benefit Rider available if face ≥ $7,000 (75% max, $100,000 cap)
Accidental Death Benefit Rider available (issue ages 50–70, expires at age 80)
Charitable Giving Rider (no premium) pays 1% of face (max $1,000)
Grandchild Rider ($60/year for grandchildren coverage, convertible by age brackets)
Guaranteed conversion to permanent coverage (until policy expiration) for grandchildren

name: Graded Death Benefit Whole Life (GDB)
features: 30% of face in Year 1, 70% in Year 2, 100% thereafter (100% for accidental death anytime)
Face amounts $5,000–$20,000; issue ages 50–85
No paramedical exam required—reflexive medical questions only
Preferred/Standard build-chart and medical history considerations apply up to age 85
Accelerated Death Benefit Rider available if face ≥ $7,000
Accidental Death Benefit Rider (issue ages 50–70, expires at age 80)
Charitable Giving Rider (no premium) pays 1% of face (max $1,000)
Grandchild Rider ($60/year for grandchildren coverage)

name: Guaranteed Issue Whole Life (GI)
features: No medical questions—automatic acceptance if age and face limits met
Pays 110% of earned premiums in Years 1–2 (natural causes), 100% face in Year 3+ (100% accidental death anytime)
Face amounts $3,000–$10,000; issue ages 50–80
No paramedical exam or medical questions at all
Charitable Giving Rider available (no premium)
Accidental Death Benefit Rider (issue ages 50–70, expires at age 80)
Grandchild Rider ($60/year for grandchildren coverage)
